snippet: Among the heroes of Sept. 11 is the construction supervisor of the slurry wall that held firm at the site, preventing the Hudson from flooding parts of Lower Manhattan.
abstract: David W Dunlap Building Blocks column on late Arturo Lamberto Ressi di Cervia, engineer who supervised construction of slurry wall around World Trade Center in 1960s; wall held during Sept 11 attacks, preventing Hudson River from flooding Lower Manhattan, along with PATH and subway tunnels below; portion of wall has been deliberately left exposed at National September 11 Memorial Museum in honor of its significance.
lead_paragraph: Among the heroes of Sept. 11 is the construction supervisor of the slurry wall that held firm at the site, preventing the Hudson from flooding parts of Lower Manhattan.

headline.main: Looking to a Wall That Limited the Devastation at the World Trade Center
headline.print_headline:
On Sept. 11, a Wall
Limited the Devastation

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
